sn22.51:4.2: “Mendicants, form really is impermanent. A mendicant sees that it is impermanent:
sn22.51:4.5: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.51:4.6: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.
sn22.51:4.18: Consciousness really is impermanent. A mendicant sees that it is impermanent:
sn22.51:4.21: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.51:4.22: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.”
